qas.question: What was the market value of the endowment the college received on July 31, 2015?

answers.text: a unit trust vehicle for College, Faculties and Departments to invest endowments and unfettered income to produce returns for the long term

context: The College's endowment is sub-divided into <a4_0>three<a4_0/> distinct portfolios: (i) <a5_0>Unitised Scheme<a5_0/> – <a1_0>a unit trust vehicle for College, Faculties and Departments to invest endowments and unfettered income to produce returns for the long term<a1_0/>; (ii) <a6_0>Non-Core Property<a6_0/> – a portfolio containing around <b10_0><b11_0>120<b11_0/><b10_0/> operational and developmental properties which College has determined are not core to the academic mission; and (iii) <a7_0>Strategic Asset Investments<a7_0/> – containing College’s shareholding in Imperial Innovations and other restricted equity holdings. During the <b9_0>year 2014/15<b9_0/>, the market value of the endowment increased by <a2_0><a8_0>£78 million<a8_0/><a2_0/> (<a3_0>18%<a3_0/>) to <a0_0>£512.4 million<a0_0/> on 31 July 2015.
